name: Hi! Montemar Apartamentos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very worried when we had read some of the other reviews about this hotel but when we got there we were pleasantly surprised. It was a bit of a trek when walking back from town up the hill and then up the 90 steps to our room but this didn't ruin our holiday or even put us off going to this hotel again. No ants in our room at all. Sure the room could do with a bit of attention but this did not ruin our holiday. It was clean and that's what matters most to us. I think as we were self catering we were placed in block M which is furthest away from the pool and bar etc but this was ideal for us as we were a couple with no children and therefore only ventured down to the pool once. As were in room M9 I think this was the reason there were no ants - I think block K may have been different. Cala Llonga itself was a nice resort with a gorgeous beach but very catered for the british which isn't really what we look for when we go abroad. We visited es Cana to the hippy market on the wednesday and visited ibiza town and visited the old town which was lovely. We had food at Valentinos which is in the centre of Cala Llonga, two nights. This was a lovely Italian restaurant which had the best ever bruschetta - I would highly recommend it, the service was also very good. We also had food at Zebra's which is on the way to the Hi Montemar hotel from the town centre. This was by far the best meal we had and the service was great. We also ate at the Terrace which was nice, it was cheap and very good value. We ate at Restaurant Cala Llonga which was on the beach front - service by the waitress was not very good and the SOS again very british menu! Boring!
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.text: Yes the place could do with a face lift and aircon, but for a family on a budget it is great.
reviews.title: I would go back tomorrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read the reviews after we booked and was slightly worried, I need not have been, and neither should you. I don't know what these other people who left bad reviews expect of a Spanish 3* appartment obviously far to much! and as for "the hill from hell", we were in the furthest block from the pool, around about 90 - 100 steps, I am 51 with arthritic hips and high blood pressure, I did not find the hill or steps any trouble at all. ignore the bad reveiws, the staff are great very friendly and they work their socks off. Prepare to put on wieght though with all the food that you will eat, good quality fish, meat, cold cuts and salads. One word of warning you will have The court of King Corracticous in your head for a while, you'll see.. Dont go if you are wheel chair bound.
reviews.title: lovely bay to relax

reviews.text: my husband and I have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Montemar apartments. I had read previous reviews and did send an e-mail asking if we could be placed not to far back but not poolside this was either not read or ignored. We arrived in the early afternoon after a short bus transfer from the airport which was hottest part of the day, the rep told us where to go for reception and left us. there was a very pleasant english lady who told us she lives in Majorca but was working on the animation at the apartments she gave us our room keya and helped us to the room, this was the highest point of the aprtments and we later discovered was 90 steps from the bottom to the room. We were wrecked every time we climbed to the room, there was also a family located that hight up which we didnt think was the right thing to have done as they also had buggies to lug as well as the children, the plus side was you got very little noise from the entertainment in the evening and were surrounded by a lovely wooded area. When you check in they do give you a leaflet giving some informaiton of the apartment and also a request to consider your neighbours in the evening and to keep noise down after twelve, there was only one night where we were disturbed but nothing to complain to much about. On the second day we decided that we would try the poolside but only did this on one day, there was music being played rather loudly around this area and also the noise from the animation team all day, although the notice given was not to reserve sunbeds the pool was not open until 10am (i think this was to allow cleaning which we could see being done from our apartment) bviously ngnored and we had to grab a sunbed on the terrace area, there was also very few sun shades for the number of beds and people. The apartment also offered all inclusive however we did not try the food facility therefore I am unable to comment on. The apartment although not huge was of ample space for the two of us and had a fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and hob facility which was adequate a long with a glass topped table (I was unsure of this especially if anything happened and it broke) and two chairs which i also didnt think necessary in the room as the balcony also had table and chairs and was of a lovely size, the sun was at the balcony until very late in the evening. the bathroom had the usual loo, handbasin and shower, the bedroom area was two beds with bedside cabinets wardrobe facility with a safe charged at 24 euro per week with 10 euro deposit. there was a television but i could only get spanish channels although the information said sky channels unless you had to subscribe to but I didnt bother to ask and a ceiling fan. The cleaning of the aprtment was not done very often if at all but there was emptying of the bins and cleaning of the bathroom but the bedding was changed with only two nights left which we have never experience before, on arrival we did not have any handtowels in the bathroom and I requested some and didnt receive until three days later. Although the apartments are at the top of a steep hill they were adequate for what we wanted and would return.
reviews.title: Worst accommodation in 25 yrs abroad

reviews.text: The beach was lovely and a walk down the road, the sunbeds and parasols cost 3.60 euro each to hire but worth it for us for the peace away from the pool. We used to visit the cafe Del Mar by the beach with the owner Fernando serving the food was always hot and tasty, we ate at the Restaurant Cala LLonga, SOS and Dohna Regina all had nice food I would recommend that you stay clear of the Snack Box my husband and I ordered our meals and the girl gave my husband what he had ordered and as he waited to eat with me nothing was set down and after about 15mins I went to ask where it was and she said she had forgotten to write the order down and had not ordered i did wait and eat but would not go back. (tip from me) when buying the large bottles of water also buy a smaller one for each member of your party or a couple of the litre bottles, in the evenings fill them up and put in freezer part of fridge and take to the poolside or beach and as they thaw it keeps them cold for quite some time
reviews.title: great holiday

reviews.text: Like many others i read the reviews and was concerned having two young children and two teenagers with me and my partner. No need to have worried. Arrived at 01:30 and Kevin the night security guy allocated our key and took us to our room, He even got us cold water from the dining room as nowhere open that late. Appartment could do with a lick of paint and some tlc but other than that absolutely no problems. Bedding clean and loads of towels. Plenty of space for the six of us. What a surprise on waking the first morning. lovely open view over pool area and no problems at all getting sunbeds for all of us. All inclusive option was well worth the money, kids ate at every mealtime with no complaint, always something they liked.Fresh fruit and salad options were a welcome to the usual all inc food we have eaten at other hotels.Kids made use of free ice cream and drinks constantly throughout the day.
reviews.title: Cracking value for money, been too far worse and paid a lot more.

reviews.text: All staff we encountered were very helpful, and like the previous few reviews i have to take my hat off to Liam and his entertainment team. Liam himself is an absolute star, constantly on the go and when we left last night it was as if we had known him for longer than the week. The kids idolised him and i can honestly state i have not seen an entertainer at a hotel put as much effort into his role as this man did. Hi Hotels shpuld make sure they keep hold of him before he is snapped up by a much bigger hotel chain. All in all excellent value for money and if the rooms were just given a coat of paint the whole experience would be superb.
reviews.title: PERFECT HOLIDAY!

reviews.text: We stayed here 19th -26th Aug with our daughters 15yrs + 9yrs. We loved everything about it. The lay out of the bar, pool and restaurant was spot on! We were kindly shown to our apartment which was on 'I' floor. It had 2 bedrooms, good sized living area, kitchen, bathroom and a good sized balcony with great views. There were fans in the bedrooms which made it comfortable. Air conditioned rooms are available which you would request when booking, we was happy without. As for ants, we were all inclusive and didn't have food in the apartment so that wasn't a problem although when we brought drinks to the room, in the morning there were a few around the cups which was from our own doing. They are not like our ants back at home, they are tiny, no big deal. There were 60 steps to our apartment which we knew there would be some and if you're spending your time lazing around, sunbathing, eating etc you really can't complain. There is a spar shop just down the road and a little further on, the beautiful beach, shops and places to eat. The food in Montemar was of a very high standard. There would've been something for everyone at all times, lots of choice meats and fish, and always something the kids would eat. Tubs of ice-creams were available between mealtimes but you had to go into the restaurant through reception as the doors were locked which people might not have been aware of. The entertainment was absolutely brilliant thanks to Liam.... he really is the best, everyone loved his humour, adults and kids alike. There was plenty of daytime activities for the kids if they wanted and the evenings were always fun. The pool was well set out with a really deep area too. There was no leaving your towels on sunbeds early to save them for later as the security guard would remove them! we were told by him that to just get your sunbed no earlier than 8am and we didn't have a problem. Having a security guard and life guard was nicely reassuring. All in all, a great holiday which we would definitely come back to again.
reviews.title: loved it and would go back!!

reviews.text: we were very worried about staying here as we had also read the bad reveiws.But we need'nt of been so stressed,its an excellent place to stay.All the staff are very hardworking,eager to please,polite and friendly.If u do have a problem then tell them,and i'm sure they will do their very best to rectify it.Joanna the receptionest welcomed us and show us to our apartment, which made our day as we were'nt looking forward to trying to find it oursleves.Liam the entertainer is fantastic all the kids and adults loved him.We went all inclusive and have no complaints,you are able to eat more or less all day,breakfast,snack,lunch,snack then dinner,what more can you ask for,you will find something you like throughout the day,i'm sure!!there were a few ants,the hill is a small price to pay for the beach,but well worth it,the stairs are not that bad except when you have your cases,although i did trip up them every night after a few too many vodkas,and our apartment was VERY clean,with lovely veiws.Wish we were still there!!
reviews.title: SUNBEDS!!!

reviews.text: Ok heres how it is...if you want a hol with a sunbed by the pool be willing to put up a fight!!! Unless you leave your towel out a night, forget it your nit getting one!! The rooms are clean but basic...you get what you pay for and this isnt 5*! Luckily we had aircon tho the receptionist turned it on when we arrived and it didnt turn off so we needed blankets on a night. The beach is lovely and seen as your not getting by the pool its a good job!! There is a hill up to apartments but its not that bad and you can stroll up after all it is your hol!! Great bus service runs thru town frim outside tobbaconist. We ate at the terrace, which was lovely with great staff and also one right on the beach next to del mar and thay place wad great too. Enjoyed calla llonga...only complaint would be the sunbeds and tell me why do you need to get yourself up at a ridiculous hr to reserve a sunbed with your towel???!!!! relax people your on holiday!!!
reviews.title: Best Holiday So Far!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Montemar in September for a week. As many others, we were a bit apprehensive about our stay after reading some of the reviews on here but were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. I think a lot depends on how much you have spent to say here. We spent £380pp for a week AI and it was great value for money. One single traveller we spoke to was charged over £900 for 10 days AI through Thomas Cook so it definately pays to shop around!! There were a lot of Spanish guests staying at the same time as us, although the majority were SC.
reviews.title: Basic but everything you need for a week in the sun

reviews.text: Yes the apartments are basic, the bathroom was in a serious need of a facelift but it was clean and had everything you needed for the week. We stayed in K4 (108 steps from the pool!!) and our apartment had a very large double bedroom with plenty of wardrobes and shelves, a living room/dining room area with a small kitchen, dining table, sofa bed and zed-bed, and an enormous balcony with table and chairs looking down the hill towards the pool. On the down side, we only had new towels and a maid visit on the second day of our stay, no new towels or sheets for the rest of the week. We never saw a single ant or bug in our room, although we did hear a few people say that they did.
reviews.title: Not all reviews you read are true

reviews.text: The pool area was always clean, plenty of sunloungers but you had to be quick to get a parasol. On the days we stayed by the pool we sat on the sundeck area - nice views over the pine forests and no risk of getting hit by a stray beach ball! The pool was one of the deepest I have seen - 3.6m at the deepest! But it was great for kids (big and small!) jumping in and not having to worry about hitting the bottom. The shape meant that the shallow 'childrens' end was far away from where the water polo was played and seemed to be very safe for kids.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday.......

reviews.text: The bar served a variety of drinks, cocktails, beer and wine - can recommend the pinacolada and the sangria! You are limited to two drinks at a time when it is busier. We took thermos cups with us and they were more than happy to fill them up for us - saves trips to the bar and your drinks stay nice and cold for hours despite the heat!
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday, entertainment great, would love to go back

reviews.text: I heard a lot of people moan about the food but it was definitely above the standard I was expecting and I personally could not fault it. I can not eat wheat so was a bit worried about what to eat but I never went hungry (or had to eat weird combinations of food to get a full plate!) : BREAKFAST bacon, sausage, egg, beans, toast, cakes, croisants, fresh & dried fruit, yogurts, cheeses, choiritzo, ham LUNCH & DINNER large salad bar, cheeses & cold meats, chips, rice, at least two meat dishes (one plain - i.e. grilled beef or chicken and one with a 'sauce' i.e. beef stew, chicken in a sauce etc.) pasta dish and fish dish and fresh water melon, grapes, pineapple, cakes, ice cream, rice pudding etc for desserts.
reviews.title: WE LOVED IT AND WOULD LOVE TO GO BACK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2011 my partner and myself had booked a last minute holiday, all enclusive. Hotel is average and clean. Food was ok but limited with lots of carbs!!!!! Rice and chips on menu most nights. Pool and apartment clean but we were not made aware of gym/spa???? and football pitch/tennis court overgrown and unsuitable.. the apartment was however basic with 'tired' furniture and fittings. Not ideal for the elderley and the unfit dependant upon your apartment location, as many steps. Loads of children and child based entertainement with music and lots of noise through the day and night by pool. NOT for couples seeking to chill and a romantic setting. Having said this the hotel met with expectation and is what you get for the money, a 2/3 star residence. The staff were pleasant and especialoly the lovely Dutch lady on reception who was extremely helpful and interested in our requests. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Cala Llonga which is a pleasant resort with lovely beach, but would stay in a different hotel next time.
reviews.title: The simple truth!!

reviews.text: Stayed in block K which must have been 100 steps up which wasn't great with heavy cases and a badly drawn map.
reviews.title: Dirty, ant ridden and run down. Never again!

reviews.text: When we first arrived we were given the wrong keys and sent to the wrong apartment. We only realised when we saw people's clothes in the apartment! Great security.
reviews.title: Very Good all round, beautiful area.

reviews.text: When we finally got to our room it stank and was very tatty and worn out. Ants were rife, especially in the kitchen. So much so that even being self catering we had to eat out all the time.
reviews.title: We loved it and would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sheets were not changed and they only changed the towels after we nagged them after 5 days.
reviews.title: We value for the price

aka: Hi! Montemar Apartamentos Hotel Cala Llonga
description: An idyllic island, white sandy beaches, turquoise waters, romantic sunrises, these are the memories we will take home from this magnificent place. Located on a hill, surrounded by hundred-year old pine trees and a beautiful view of the mountains give the complex an especially relaxing atmosphere. This beautiful holiday complex is located in Cala Llonga, Ibiza, and is 500 metres from a beautiful sandy beach. 29 studio-apartments, 22 one-bedroom apartment and 63 two-bedroom apartments. All with balcony or terrace, equipped with kitchen, fridge, microwave, SAT TV, safe rental, bath, shower, toilet. 1 adults pool y another independent pool for children, tennis with extra charge, entertainment program for adults and children with evening shows.I
